description.p: With a quasit sitting on his shoulder, a young elf in golden robes smiles warmly, weaving a magical charm into his honeyed words and bending the palace sentinel to his will.
As flames spring to life in her hands, a wizened human whispers the secret name of her demonic patron, infusing her spell with abyssal powers.
Shifting his gaze between a battered tome and the odd alignment of the stars overhead, a wild-eyed tiefling chants the mystic ritual that will open a doorway to a distant world.

Warlocks are seekers of the knowledge that lies hidden in the fabric of the multiverse. Through pacts made with mysterious beings of supernatural power, warlocks unlock magical effects both subtle and spectacular. Drawing on the ancient knowledge of beings such as fey nobles, demons, devils, hags, and alien entities of the Far Realm, warlocks piece together arcane secrets to bolster their own power.

A warlock is defined by a pact with an otherworldly being. Sometimes the relationship between warlock and patron is like that of a cleric and a deity, though the beings that serve as patrons for warlocks are not gods. A warlock might lead a cult dedicated to a demon prince, an archdevil, or an utterly alien entity—beings not typically served by clerics. More often, though, the arrangement is similar to that between a master and an apprentice. The warlock learns and grows in power, at the cost of occasional services performed on the patron’s behalf.

The magic bestowed on a warlock ranges from minor but lasting alterations to the warlock’s being (such as the ability to see in darkness or to read any language) to access to powerful spells. Unlike bookish wizards, warlocks supplement their magic with some facility at hand-to-hand combat. They are comfortable in light armor and know how to use simple weapons.

Warlocks are driven by an insatiable need for knowledge and power, which compels them into their pacts and shapes their lives. This thirst drives warlocks into their pacts and shapes their later careers as well.

Stories of warlocks binding themselves to fiends are widely known. But many warlocks serve patrons that are not fiendish. Sometimes a traveler in the wilds comes to a strangely beautiful tower, meets its fey lord or lady, and stumbles into a pact without being fully aware of it. And sometimes, while poring over tomes of forbidden lore, a brilliant but crazed student’s mind is opened to realities beyond the material world and to the alien beings that dwell in the outer void.

Once a pact is made, a warlock’s thirst for knowledge and power can’t be slaked with mere study and research. No one makes a pact with such a mighty patron if he or she doesn’t intend to use the power thus gained. Rather, the vast majority of warlocks spend their days in active pursuit of their goals, which typically means some kind of adventuring. Furthermore, the demands of their patrons drive warlocks toward adventure.

As you make your warlock character, spend some time thinking about your patron and the obligations that your pact imposes upon you. What led you to make the pact, and how did you make contact with your patron? Were you seduced into summoning a devil, or did you seek out the ritual that would allow you to make contact with an alien elder god? Did you search for your patron, or did your patron find and choose you? Do you chafe under the obligations of your pact or serve joyfully in anticipation of the rewards promised to you?

Work with your DM to determine how big a part your pact will play in your character’s adventuring career. Your patron’s demands might drive you into adventures, or they might consist entirely of small favors you can do between adventures.

What kind of relationship do you have with your patron? Is it friendly, antagonistic, uneasy, or romantic? How important does your patron consider you to be? What part do you play in your patron’s plans? Do you know other servants of your patron?

How does your patron communicate with you? If you have a chained companion, it might occasionally speak with your patron’s voice. Some warlocks find messages from their patrons etched on trees, mingled among tea leaves, or adrift in the clouds — messages that only the warlock can see. Other warlocks converse with their patrons in dreams or waking visions, or deal only with intermediaries.

You can make a warlock quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the charlatan background. Third, choose the thaumaturgy and chill touch cantrips, along with the 1st-level spells charm person and armor of Agathys.
As an warlock, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per warlock level after 1st
Skills: Choose two skills from Arcana, Deception, History, Intimidation, Investigation, Nature, and Religion

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) a component pouch or (b) an arcane focus
(a) a scholar’s pack or (b) a dungeoneer’s pack
Leather armor, any simple weapon, and two daggers

tr.td: Otherworldly Patron, Pact Boon, Pact Magic

setters.set: A wielder of magic that is derived from a bargain with an extraplanar entity.

description.p: At 1st level, you have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level. Those features include an expanded spell list.

Each patron has a list of associated spells-its bestowed spells-you gain access to these spells at the levels specified in the patron description. Once you gain a bestowed spell, you always know it, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you know.
If you gain a spell that doesn’t appear on the warlock spell list, the spell is nonetheless a warlock spell for you.

Additionally at 1st level, you have received a boon from your Otherworldly Patron as part of the pact you made each detailed at the end of the class description. This Boon also grants you additional features at 3rd, 5th, 9th, and 18th level.

Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. See Spells Rules for the general rules of spellcasting and the Spells Listing for the warlock spell list.
You know two cantrips of your choice from the warlock spell list. You learn additional warlock cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Warlock table.

The Warlock table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell witch bolt, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.
description.h5: SPELLS KNOWN OF 1ST LEVEL AND HIGHER
description.p: At 1st level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the warlock spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Warlock table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what’s shown in the table’s Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 6th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

center.p: Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier
Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

description.p: You can use an arcane focus as a spellcasting focus for your warlock spells.

sheet.description: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. You have {{warlock:spellcasting:slots:count}} slots of level {{warlock:spellcasting:slot}}

description.p: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability.

At 2nd level, you gain one eldritch invocation of your choice. Your invocation options are detailed at the end of the document. When you gain certain warlock levels, you gain additional invocations of your choice, as shown in the Invocations Known column of the Warlock table.
To swap an Invocation you must come to an understanding with your patron, something which might require completing a task for your patron.
At 2nd level, you hinder your enemies with mere words. Using a bonus action, you can hex a target within 90 feet for 1 minute.

Until the hex ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the target. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once) and regain all you expended uses when finish a long rest.
You can only have one target hexed active at a time and a remove curse cast on the target ends this effect early.

sheet.description: Using a bonus action, you can hex a target within 90 feet for 1 minute. Until the hex ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the target. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability. You can only have one target hexed active at a time and a remove curse cast on the target ends this effect early.

description.p: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
At 11th level, your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list as this arcanum.
You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more warlock spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at 13th level, one 8th-level spell at 15th level, and one 9th-level spell at 17th level. You regain all uses of your Mystic Arcanum when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again. You regain all uses of your Mystic Arcanum when you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 20th level, you can draw on your inner reserve of mystical power while entreating your patron to regain expended spell slots. You can spend 1 action to regain all your expended spell slots from your Pact Magic feature. Once you regain spell slots with this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

sheet.description: You can spend 1 action to regain all your expended spell slots from your Pact Magic feature.

description.p: You cannot learn the Hex or Eldritch Blast spells normally.

sheet.description: You cannot learn the Hex or Eldritch Blast spells normally.

description.p: The Pact of the Tome provides a warlock with a means of recording their spells and other pieces of arcane knowledge, allowing them to more easily catalogue their findings and spells. Warlocks who have such a book spend much of their time studying forbidden and long-forgotten lore in order to increase their knowledge and magical ability.

sheet.description: The Pact of the Tome provides a warlock with a means of recording their spells and other pieces of arcane knowledge

description.p: At 1st level, your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Erudition. When you gain this feature, you gain the eldritch blast cantrip and two other cantrips of your choice from any spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known. If they don’t appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you.

If you lose your Book of Erudition, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

sheet.description: You gain the eldritch blast cantrip and two other cantrips of your choice from any spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known. If they don’t appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you. If you lose your Book of Erudition, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

description.p: At 3rd level, you can now inscribe magical rituals in your Book of Erudition. Choose two 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Erudition in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

On your adventures, you can add other ritual spells to your Book of Erudition. When you find such a spell, you can add it to the book if the spell's level is equal to or less than half your warlock level (rounded up) and if you can spare the time to transcribe the spell. For each level of the spell, the transcription process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp for the rare inks needed to inscribe it.

sheet.description: Choose two 1st-level spells that have the ritual tag from any class's spell list. The spells appear in the book and don't count against the number of spells you know. With your Book of Erudition in hand, you can cast the chosen spells as rituals. You can't cast the spells except as rituals, unless you've learned them by some other means. You can also cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual if it has the ritual tag.

description.p: At 5th level, when you cast a damaging cantrip, add your Intelligence modifier to the damage it deals on a hit.

sheet.description: When you cast a damaging cantrip, add {{intelligence:modifier}} to the damage it deals on a hit.

description.p: At 9th level, your Book of Erudition is no longer destroyed when you die, and it can be used in place of your corpse to restore you to life.

Additionally, whenever a creature that you can see within 120 feet of you dies or you touch a corpse, you can choose to have their name be magically inscribed in your Book of Erudition. That creature’s corpse is always considered to be present and whole within your Book, creating a new copy of the body when needed. If your Book of Erudition is destroyed, all the names within are lost, even if the book is restored.

sheet.description: Your Book of Erudition is no longer destroyed when you die, and it can be used in place of your corpse to restore you to life. Additionally, whenever a creature that you can see within 120 feet of you dies or you touch a corpse, you can choose to have their name be magically inscribed in your Book of Erudition. That creature’s corpse is always considered to be present and whole within your Book, creating a new copy of the body when needed. If your Book of Erudition is destroyed, all the names within are lost, even if the book is restored.

description.p: At 18th level, whenever you cast a cantrip on your turn, you can use your bonus action to cast a different cantrip.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast a cantrip on your turn, you can use your bonus action to cast a different cantrip.

description.p: The Pact of the Blade turns a warlock into an eldritch warrior, supplementing their magical prowess with martial skills. Warlocks who receive this boon are warriors of the occult. They may fight in their patron's name, slaying those who would threaten or oppose them; or they may use their knowledge of the occult to attempt to stop their enemies.

sheet.description: The Pact of the Blade turns a warlock into an eldritch warrior, supplementing their magical prowess with martial skills.

description.p: Starting at 1st level, you gain proficiency with medium and heavy armor, shields, and martial weapons.

Also, you can transform up to two weapons (one can be a shield) into your Pact Weapons by performing a special ritual while you hold them. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour. You can’t affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it.
A Pact Weapon counts as a spellcasting focus and magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency with medium and heavy armor, shields, and martial weapons. Also, you can transform up to two weapons (one can be a shield) into your Pact Weapons by performing a special ritual while you hold them. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour. You can’t affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. A Pact Weapon counts as a spellcasting focus and magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you can shunt your Pact Weapons into an extradimensional space (no action required), and you can make one or both reappear as an action.
The weapons appear at your feet if they are in the extradimensional space when the bonds break.
A Pact Weapon disappears into its extradimensional space if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. The bond breaks when you die.

sheet.description: You can shunt your Pact Weapons into an extradimensional space (no action required), and you can make one or both reappear as an action. The weapons appear at your feet if they are in the extradimensional space when the bonds break. A Pact Weapon disappears into its extradimensional space if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. The bond breaks when you die.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, you can attack with your pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can attack with your pact weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 9th level, when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).

Additionally, after you hit but before you roll damage with your pact weapon, you can use your Hex ability on the target (no action required) and while a target is under the effect of your Hex, any weapon attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes an extra {{intelligence:modifier}} necrotic damage (minimum 1). Additionally, after you hit but before you roll damage with your pact weapon, you can use your Hex ability on the target (no action required) and while a target is under the effect of your Hex, any weapon attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

description.p: At 18th level, during your turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can use your bonus action to cast a Pact Magic spell with a casting time of 1 action.

sheet.description: During your turn when you hit a creature with your pact weapon, you can use your bonus action to cast a Pact Magic spell with a casting time of 1 action.

description.p: The pact of the idol lets the warlock spread the influence of their patron, by granting their allies a taste of the boons that are available to them if they would put their lives in the hands of your patron. The influence of a patron can increase at an incredible pace by having this powerful idol come into contact with as many creatures as possible. Warlocks who carry this gift often find themselves the center of the party, as they share their power in order to empower their allies.

sheet.description: The pact of the idol lets the warlock spread the influence of their patron, by granting their allies a taste of the boons that are available to them if they would put their lives in the hands of your patron.

description.p: At 1st level, your patron gives you a unique idol. While wearing this charm in a visible location; as a clasp, brooch, or necklace, you can cast the thaumaturgy cantrip at will. If another creature is wearing it both you and the creature can cast message at will, at any range, and without pointing at the target, but you can only target each other.
You also gain the word of radiance cantrip. If another creature is wearing the idol, you can cast it as if you were standing in its place. You can choose for it to deal necrotic damage.
If you lose the idol, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet.
The idol turns to motes of light when you die.

sheet.description: While wearing this charm in a visible location; as a clasp, brooch, or necklace, you can cast the thaumaturgy cantrip at will. If another creature is wearing it both you and the creature can cast message at will, at any range, and without pointing at the target, but you can only target each other. You also gain the word of radiance cantrip. If another creature is wearing the idol, you can cast it as if you were standing in its place. You can choose for it to deal necrotic damage. If you lose the idol, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, when the wearer makes an ability check with a skill in which they lack proficiency, they can add a d4 to the roll.

sheet.description: When the wearer makes an ability check with a skill in which they lack proficiency, they can add a d4 to the roll.

description.p: Starting at 5th level, when the wearer of your idol is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal psychic damage to the attacker equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 damage) and push it up to 10 feet away from the idol’s wearer.

sheet.description: When the wearer of your idol is hit by an attacker you can see within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to deal {{intelligence:modifier}} psychic damage to the attacker (minimum of 1 damage) and push it up to 10 feet away from the idol’s wearer.

description.p: At 9th, when the wearer of your idol makes a saving throw in which they lack proficiency, they can add a d4 to the roll.

sheet.description: When the wearer of your idol makes a saving throw in which they lack proficiency, they can add a d4 to the roll.

description.p: At 18th level, while someone else is wearing your idol, you can use your bonus action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence.
The wearer of your idol can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you.

sheet.description: While someone else is wearing your idol, you can use your bonus action to teleport to the unoccupied space closest to them, provided the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The wearer of your idol can do the same thing, using their action to teleport to you.

description.p: The Pact of the Shroud dresses the warlock in powerful vesture, protecting from them whomever or whatever that tries to deny their or their patron its place in the cosmos. Often seen as mediators or heralds of their patron, no one can deny the favor they have been granted, though many try. Those who take this route are often headstrong and the first to take a stand against something they don't believe in.

sheet.description: The Pact of the Shroud dresses the warlock in powerful vesture, protecting from them whomever or whatever that tries to deny their or their patron its place in the cosmos.

description.p: At 1st level, you've been granted powerful vestments from your patron, clearly stating your allegiance to your patron. While you are wearing your vestments you gain two damaging non-weapon cantrips of your choice from any spell list. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known. If they don’t appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you.

If you lose your Vestments of the Chosen, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a long rest, and it destroys the previous ones. The vestments fade into smoke when you die.

sheet.description: While you are wearing your vestments you gain two damaging non-weapon cantrips of your choice from any spell list. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known. If they don’t appear on the warlock spell list, they are nonetheless warlock spells for you. If you lose your Vestments of the Chosen, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a long rest, and it destroys the previous ones. The vestments fade into smoke when you die.

description.p: At 3rd level, while you are wearing your vestments and not wearing any armor or shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: While you are wearing your vestments and not wearing any armor or shield, your Armor Class equals {{ac:cloaked in power}}.

description.p: At 5th level, when a creature misses you with an attack while you are wearing your vestments, you can use your reaction to cast a non-weapon cantrip targeting that creature.
Additionally, while you are wearing your vestments and not wearing any armor or shield, opportunity attacks made against you are made with disadvantage.

sheet.description: When a creature misses you with an attack while you are wearing your vestments, you can use your reaction to cast a non-weapon cantrip targeting that creature. Additionally, while you are wearing your vestments and not wearing any armor or shield, opportunity attacks made against you are made with disadvantage.

description.p: At 9th level, after a creature under the effect of your Hex ability makes an attack against you, it takes necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).
Also, you have resistance to any damage a creature under the effect of your Hex ability deals.

sheet.description: After a creature under the effect of your Hex ability makes an attack against you, it takes {{intelligence:modifier}} necrotic damage (minimum of 1). Also, you have resistance to any damage a creature under the effect of your Hex ability deals.

description.p: At 18th level, if you take the Dodge action, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action.

sheet.description: If you take the Dodge action, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action.

description.p: The Pact of the Unleashed changes the warlocks into something more, something dangerous. Warlocks who have gone through this change sometimes change more than just their appearance, becoming quick to anger or hungering for blood.
Often these changes makes them look more similar to their patron, proof of their unique bond. They are often unleashed to remove the patron's enemies or problems through fear or death.

sheet.description: Warlocks who have gone through this change sometimes change more than just their appearance, becoming quick to anger or hungering for blood.

description.p: At 1st level, your patron has transformed your body, granting you natural melee weapons in the form of claws, fangs, tentacles, or similar extensions. You are proficient with these weapons and you can use either your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls you make with them.
They deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (you make this choice when you gain this ability). You can use a bonus action to withdraw or manifest your natural weapons.

sheet.description: You gain natural melee weapons in the form of claws, fangs, tentacles, or similar extensions. You are proficient with these weapons and you can use either your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls you make with them. They deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (you make this choice when you gain this ability). You can use a bonus action to withdraw or manifest your natural weapons.

You gain natural melee weapons in the form of claws, fangs, tentacles, or similar extensions. You are proficient with these weapons and you can use either your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls you make with them. They deal 1d8 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (you make this choice when you gain this ability). You can use a bonus action to withdraw or manifest your natural weapons.

description.p: At 3rd level, when you use your Action to cast a cantrip or to take the Attack or Dash action, you can use your bonus action to make an attack using your natural weapon and gain an extra 10 feet of movement until the end of your turn.

sheet.description: When you use your Action to cast a cantrip or to take the Attack or Dash action, you can use your bonus action to make an attack using your natural weapon and gain an extra 10 feet of movement until the end of your turn.

description.p: At 5th level, your natural weapons attacks are considered magical and you can attack with your natural weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

sheet.description: Your natural weapons attacks are considered magical and you can attack with your natural weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

description.p: At 9th level, the damage of your natural weapons is increased to 1d8 of your chosen damage type.
Addtionally, when a creature under the effect of your Hex is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to regain hit points equal to your warlock level.

sheet.description: When a creature under the effect of your Hex is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to regain {{level:warlock}} hit points.

description.p: Beginning at 18th level, when you use your action to cast a spell, you can use your bonus action to attack twice with your natural weapons.

sheet.description: When you use your action to cast a spell, you can use your bonus action to attack twice with your natural weapons.

description.p: Some are born with exceptional talent, some spend all their time trying to reach such skill. Others...find it or have it thrust upon them. Somehow you found yourself with a musical instrument which ables you to perform the most impressive music pieces and melodies.
While you hold the instrument, it is like your fingers are moving by themselves, or like some other being are controlling your hands. Does this scare you? Or is this something that you see as a gift?

sheet.description: Somehow you found yourself with a musical instrument which ables you to perform the most impressive music pieces and melodies.

description.p: At 1st level, your patron gives you a musical instrument called a Sinister Implement. While holding this instrument, you can cast the concussive chord, instill courage, and nudge cantrips. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known and are considered warlock spells for you.

If you lose your Sinister Implement, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a long rest, and it destroys the previous instrument. The instrument foils into itself with a horrible noise when you die.
You are proficient with your Sinister Implement and it counts as a spellcasting focus for you.

sheet.description: Your patron gives you a musical instrument called a Sinister Implement. While holding this instrument, you can cast the concussive chord, instill courage, and nudge cantrips. They don’t count against your number of cantrips known and are considered warlock spells for you. If you lose your Sinister Implement, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. You are proficient with your Sinister Implement and it counts as a spellcasting focus for you.

description.p: At 3rd level, as long as you hold your Sinister Implement you are considered proficient in Performance and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. Additionally, your cantrips gain the following benefits:
Concussive Chord. On a hit, the target is frightened of you until the start of your next turn. If the target takes damage, this effect ends.
Instill Courage. If a target is charmed, it can repeat the saving throw as it could if it was frightened.
Nudge. On a failure, the target is charmed by you until the start of your next turn. If the target takes damage, this effect ends.

sheet.description: As long as you hold your Sinister Implement you are considered proficient in Performance and your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it. Additionally, your cantrips gain the following benefits: Concussive Chord: On a hit, the target is frightened of you until the start of your next turn. If the target takes damage, this effect ends. Instill Courage: If a target is charmed, it can repeat the saving throw as it could if it was frightened. Nudge: On a failure, the target is charmed by you until the start of your next turn. If the target takes damage, this effect ends.

description.p: At 5th level, when you cast on of your cantrips you gained from Sinister Implement, you can target an additional creature within 30 feet of the target with the same cantrip.

sheet.description: When you cast on of your cantrips you gained from Sinister Implement, you can target an additional creature within 30 feet of the target with the same cantrip.

description.p: At 9th level, a creature under the effect of your Hex ability, automatically fails it saving throw against nudge unless it has one or more Legendary Resistances.
Also, if you target a creature under the effect of your Hex ability with concussive chord it takes thunder damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: A creature under the effect of your Hex ability, automatically fails it saving throw against nudge unless it has one or more Legendary Resistances. Also, if you target a creature under the effect of your Hex ability with concussive chord it takes {{intelligence:modifier}} thunder damage.

description.p: At 18th level, when you cast a spell, you can use your bonus action to target up to three different creatures with a cantrip you gained from Sinister Implement. You can target each creature with a different cantrip.

sheet.description: When you cast a spell, you can use your bonus action to target up to three different creatures with a cantrip you gained from Sinister Implement. You can target each creature with a different cantrip.

description.p: You have made a pact with an archdevil from the depths of hell, a being bound by its word and stature. Devils spend their lives making deals, granting power for service, goods, or most commonly souls. Signing a contract with a devil is not as straight forward as it does seem, even with all the words in front of you they can be twisted to mean something completely different, something devils have spent their entire existence perfecting.

sheet.description: Your patron is an archdevil of the nine hells, a being of great power which is bound its word and stature.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Beginning at 1st level, your powers burn with the intensity of the flames of hell. Once on your turn when you deal damage, you can choose to deal an additional 1d6 fire damage to one target you damaged.

sheet.description: Once on your turn when you deal damage, you can choose to deal an additional 1d6 fire damage to one target you damaged.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can call on your patron to alter fate in your favor. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll’s effects occur.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll’s effects occur.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

sheet.description: You can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape.

At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape. At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience.

description.p: Your patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creature of legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born. This being’s motivations are often inscrutable, and sometimes whimsical, and might involve a striving for greater magical power or the settling of age-old grudges. Beings of this sort include the royalty of the fey courts, particularly strong fey, and ancient hags.

sheet.description: Your patron is a lord or lady of the fey, a creature of legend who holds secrets that were forgotten before the mortal races were born.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Starting at 1st level, your patron bestows upon you the ability to project the beguiling and fearsome presence of the fey. As an action, you can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. The creatures that fail their saving throws are all charmed or frightened by you (your choice) until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As an action, you can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. The creatures that fail their saving throws are all charmed or frightened by you (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell.

description.p: Beginning at 10th level, your patron teaches you how to turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them. You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

sheet.description: You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can plunge a creature into an illusory realm. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage.
Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which you choose. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

sheet.description: As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage. Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which you choose. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion.

description.p: Your patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes. You have bound yourself to an ancient empyrean, solar, ki-rin, unicorn, or other entity that resides in the planes of everlasting bliss. Your pact with that being allows you to experience the barest touch of the holy light that illuminates the multiverse.

Being connected to such power can cause changes in your behavior and beliefs. You might find yourself driven to annihilate the undead, to defeat fiends, and to protect the innocent. At times, your heart might also be filled with a longing for the celestial realm of your patron, and a desire to wander that paradise for the rest of your days. But you know that your mission is among mortals for now, and that your pact binds you to bring light to the dark places of the world.

sheet.description: Your patron is a powerful being of the Upper Planes which allows you to experience the barest touch of the holy light that illuminates the multiverse.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

At 1st level, you gain the ability to channel celestial energy to heal wounds. You have a pool of d6s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + your warlock level.

As a bonus action, you can heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you, spending dice from the pool. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore a number of hit points equal to the total. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.
Additionally, you learn the sacred flame cantrip.

sheet.description: You have a pool of {{divine light:pool}} d6s that you spend to fuel this healing. As a bonus action, you can heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you, spending dice from the pool. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals {{intelligence:modifier}} (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore a number of hit points equal to the total. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest. Additionally, you learn the sacred flame cantrip.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can project your patrons power to assist your allies. When a creature within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add a d8 to the roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll's effects occur.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, you gain resistance to radiant damage.

sheet.description: When a creature within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add a d8 to the roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll's effects occur. Additionally, you gain resistance to radiant damage.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you gain temporary hit points whenever you finish a short or long rest. These temporary hit points equal your half your warlock level + your Intelligence modifier. Additionally, choose up to five creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: You gain {{celestial resilience:hp}} temporary hit points whenever you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, choose up to five creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain {{intelligence:modifier}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, the radiant energy you channel allows you to resist death. When you have to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose. Each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 2d8 + your Intelligence modifier and is blinded until the end of your turn on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: When you have to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose. Each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to 2d8 + {{intelligence:modifier}} and is blinded until the end of your turn on a failed saving throw, and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that has total cover from you is not affected.

description.p: Making a deal with a demon is something extremely foolish and dangerous, since they are beings of pure instinct and emotion, doing whatever they feel like for that particular moment. This means even if they give you their word, that word is null if they decide that you look tasty, problematic, or in the way of their ambition.
Being able to maneuver such a creature's demands both a superb intellect and a way with words beyond the norm, but even then, the odds are not in your favor.

sheet.description: Your patron is an unpredictable demon lord, a being born out of the chaos of the abyss for one purpose, to bring ruin to the universe.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Starting at 1st level, the power of those who fell to you empowers you. When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + your warlock level (minimum of 1).

sheet.description: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain {{consume power:hp}} temporary hit points.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, whenever you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you can let yourself be empowered by the power of the abyss. When you do so, enemies within 5 feet of you take necrotic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier as black tendrils grasp anything close to your body.

sheet.description: Whenever you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher, enemies within 5 feet of you take {{intelligence:modifier}} necrotic damage as black tendrils grasp anything close to your body.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

sheet.description: You can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use an action to surround yourself with the void of the abyss. The effect of a 9th level darkness and silence spell are centered on you for 1 minute. You are unaffected by both these effects.
A creature hostile to you who starts its turn within the darkness takes 3d4 cold damage. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to surround yourself with the void of the abyss. The effect of a 9th level darkness and silence spell are centered on you for 1 minute. You are unaffected by both these effects. A creature hostile to you who starts its turn within the darkness takes 3d4 cold damage. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required).

description.p: Somehow you found yourself without anywhere to turn, your options depleted and truly alone, down in the darkness you asked for help. The void answered.

You have made a deal with an overwhelming force that you haven't been able to make out or define. How did it appear to you? Did a voice appear in the deepest of shadows, or did the darkness appear in a brightly lit room, where it didn't obey the ways of the natural world?
Is your patron a powerful being wrapped in the darkest of darkness, or is it the darkness within you taken form?

sheet.description: Your patron is a shapeless power who resides in the darkest corners of the world.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.
At 1st level, the darkness you create allows you to see through it, as if it had sentience. You treat darkness you create using pact magic or abilities as bright light.
Also, you learn the gloom cantrip.

sheet.description: You treat darkness you create using pact magic or abilities as bright light. Also, you learn the gloom cantrip.

description.p: At 6th level, your presence invokes hopelessness in your enemies. As an action, you can force a creature within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is restrained for 1 minute. While restrained in this way, it is blinded and deafened, and if the creature is withinin darkness, it is also frightened for the duration. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As an action, you can force a creature within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is restrained for 1 minute. While restrained in this way, it is blinded and deafened, and if the creature is withinin darkness, it is also frightened for the duration. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

description.p: At 10th level, your patron covers your movements. If you start your turn in dim light or darkness, you can choose to turn invisible for 1 minute.
You can use this feature twice, after you've done so, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: If you start your turn in dim light or darkness, you can choose to turn invisible for 1 minute.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use an action to transform into shapeless darkness for 1 minute. Your size becomes Huge, you gain immunity to the blinded, grappled, prone, and restrained conditions, as well as resistance to all damage except radiant. The space you inhabit is considered magical darkness for creatures of your choice, and it can't be illuminated or dispelled. You can freely move through and share space with other creatures. You can also cast spells as normal and while a creature is inside or next to your area, you can attack it from anywhere within as your body partly coalesce for a mere moment.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to transform into shapeless darkness for 1 minute. Your size becomes Huge, you gain immunity to the blinded, grappled, prone, and restrained conditions, as well as resistance to all damage except radiant. The space you inhabit is considered magical darkness for creatures of your choice, and it can't be illuminated or dispelled. You can freely move through and share space with other creatures. You can also cast spells as normal and while a creature is inside or next to your area, you can attack it from anywhere within as your body partly coalesce for a mere moment.

description.p: You have made a pact with an archmagi, a creature that have an exceptional amount arcane knowledge. Often these beings desire only to expand their own power and influence, only using you as a pawn in its far larger scheme. Other times, they find the urge to take on an apprentice to continue their research in the case of an untimely death. Some are even unknowing that a lesser being is siphoning their power.

sheet.description: Your patron is an exceptional spellcaster, strong enough to change the world.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Beginning at 1st level, your patron has taught you techniques for flexible spell preparation. When you finish a long rest, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.
Additionally, you gain the prestidigation cantrip.

sheet.description: When you finish a long rest, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots. Additionally, you gain the prestidigation cantrip.

description.p: At 6th level, you have been taught how to safely wrench your way through the weave. You can use an action to teleport yourself to an unoccupied space within 30 feet. Immediately after you reappear, a wave of arcane energy rushes out from your new position, and each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, each Medium or smaller creature is lifted 10 feet up in the air (if possible) where they are transfixed until the start of your next turn. While transfixed their movement speed is reduced to 0.
You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed what you can carry.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to teleport yourself to an unoccupied space within 30 feet. Immediately after you reappear, a wave of arcane energy rushes out from your new position, and each creature within 5 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, each Medium or smaller creature is lifted 10 feet up in the air (if possible) where they are transfixed until the start of your next turn. While transfixed their movement speed is reduced to 0. You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn’t exceed what you can carry.

description.p: At 10th level, you have become part of the magic you use. You gain resistance versus damage done by spells and you cannot lose concentration due to damage from spells.

sheet.description: You gain resistance versus damage done by spells and you cannot lose concentration due to damage from spells.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can temporarily shift part of the burden of spellcasting onto your patron, enabling you to transcend ordinary limitations. While you are concentrating on a warlock spell or a spell cast using an Eldritch Invocation you know, you can cast an additional warlock spell or a spell from an Eldritch Invocation you know that requires concentration and choose to maintain concentration on both spells simultaneously. If you are still maintaining concentration on both spells simultaneously after one minute, you must end your concentration on one of the spells. If you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, you lose concentration on both spells.
Once you have used this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

sheet.description: While you are concentrating on a warlock spell or a spell cast using an Eldritch Invocation you know, you can cast an additional warlock spell or a spell from an Eldritch Invocation you know that requires concentration and choose to maintain concentration on both spells simultaneously. If you are still maintaining concentration on both spells simultaneously after one minute, you must end your concentration on one of the spells. If you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, you lose concentration on both spells.

description.p: Your patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly foreign to the fabric of reality. It might come from the Far Realm, the space beyond reality, or it could be one of the elder gods known only in legends. Its motives are incomprehensible to mortals, and its knowledge so immense and ancient that even the greatest libraries pale in comparison to the vast secrets it holds. The Great Old One might be unaware of your existence or entirely indifferent to you, but the secrets you have learned allow you to draw your magic from it.

sheet.description: Your patron is a mysterious entity whose nature is utterly foreign to the fabric of reality.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Starting at 1st level, your alien knowledge gives you the ability to touch the minds of other creatures. You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

sheet.description: You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

description.p: At 6th level, you can flood the minds of those who assault you with terrifying, incomprehensible images from your patron's realm. When a creature within 60 feet damages you, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes psychic damage equal to 1d10 + half your warlock level and is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: When a creature within 60 feet damages you, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes psychic damage equal to 1d10 + {{level:warlock:half}} and is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.

description.p: At 10th level, the outer layers of your mind become alien in scope - becoming indecipherable to those who would plunder it, while revealing the true nature of the world around you. You are immune to any effect that would sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or determine you are lying, unless you allow it.

Additionally, you can use your action to open your mind to the truth of the world. For 10 minutes, you gain truesight out to 60 feet. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You are immune to any effect that would sense your emotions, read your thoughts, or determine you are lying, unless you allow it. Additionally, you can use your action to open your mind to the truth of the world. For 10 minutes, you gain truesight out to 60 feet. Once you do so, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

description.p: At 14th level, you gain the ability to infect a humanoid’s mind with the alien magic of your patron. You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid. That creature is then charmed by you until a remove curse spell of 5th level or higher is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or you use this feature again.

You can communicate telepathically with the charmed creature as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The charmed creature regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the creature isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

sheet.description: You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid. That creature is then charmed by you until a remove curse spell of 5th level or higher is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or you use this feature again. You can communicate telepathically with the charmed creature as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. The charmed creature regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the creature isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

description.p: At some point in your past you made contact with a powerful dragon and convinced them to enter a bargain with you, using a ritual to tie your soul to theirs. This might have been the reward for a service rendered, they may see you as a pawn in a larger plan, or they may simply be using you as an amusing diversion. Either way, you inherit some of the dragon’s power, as part of its soul now burns inside you.

sheet.description: Your patron is an ancient dragon, its destructive power is frightening to behold.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

When you choose this patron at 1st level, it grants you a glimpse of its power. You have to choose what color your dragon patron has. When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type which exist on the Draconic Patron table, you can change it to the damage type associated with your draconic patron.
Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic.
Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.
Your patron is a Black dragon, giving you an affinity to Acid damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to acid damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Blue dragon, giving you an affinity to Lightning damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to lightning damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Green dragon, giving you an affinity to Poison damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to poison damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Red dragon, giving you an affinity to Fire damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to fire damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a White dragon, giving you an affinity to Cold damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to cold damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Brass dragon, giving you an affinity to Fire damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to fire damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Bronze dragon, giving you an affinity to Lightning damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to lightning damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Copper dragon, giving you an affinity to Acid damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to acid damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Gold dragon, giving you an affinity to Fire damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to fire damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Your patron is a Silver dragon, giving you an affinity to Cold damage.

sheet.description: When you cast a Bestowed spell that has a damage type of acid, cold, fire, lighting, or poison, you can change it to cold damage. Additionally, you can speak, read, and write Draconic. Finally, you are immune to the effects of a dragon's Frightful Presence.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your patron empowers some of your magic. When you cast a warlock spell that deals the damage type associated with your draconic patron you may reroll a number of damage dice equal to your Intelligence modifier.

sheet.description: When you cast a warlock spell that deals the damage type associated with your draconic patron you may reroll {{intelligence:modifier}} damage dice.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you have started to gain a few draconic aspects. You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Affinity.
Additionally, when you fail a saving throw, you can choose to reroll it. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Affinity. Additionally, when you fail a saving throw, you can choose to reroll it. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

description.p: At 14th level, as an action you can channel your patron's horrible roar. Any creature of your choice within 120 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: As an action you can channel your patron's horrible roar. Any creature of your choice within 120 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

description.p: Your patron is an unstoppable force and anyone that find themselves running from him or finding themselves in a sudden storm in the midst of summer know that their time is limited. There are more than a few tales of how the Huntsman traversed into the settlement with the morning frost. As quickly as he arrived, he then disappeared in a storm of snow. Nobody really knows why he hunts, how he chooses his targets, or what he does once he finds them.
Somehow your actions has gotten his attention and when you felt his eyes upon your back, it wasn't fear that paralyzed you, but grim purpose.

sheet.description: Your patron is an unstoppable being, who hunts for reasons beyond comprehension.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Beginning at 1st level, no matter how many targets you hunt down, there's always another one. When a creature dies under the effect of your Hex ability, you can move it to a new creature within 90 feet.
Additionally, while a creature is affected by your Hex ability it has its movement speed reduced by 5 feet.

sheet.description: When a creature dies under the effect of your Hex ability, you can move it to a new creature within 90 feet. Additionally, while a creature is affected by your Hex ability it has its movement speed reduced by 5 feet.

description.p: At 6th level, you can conjure a mystical blizzard to cover your approach. As an action, the area within 20 feet of you is covered in a freezing storm for 1 minute. This area moves with you, is heavily obscured to all creatures but you, and exposed flames in the area are doused. Creatures of your choice takes 2d4 cold damage when they start their turn in the area.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As an action, the area within 20 feet of you is covered in a freezing storm for 1 minute. This area moves with you, is heavily obscured to all creatures but you, and exposed flames in the area are doused. Creatures of your choice takes 2d4 cold damage when they start their turn in the area.

description.p: At 10th level, you gain resistance to cold damage as the freezing temperatures has tempered your body.
Also, if you deal cold damage through an ability or spell, you gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

sheet.description: You gain resistance to cold damage. Also, if you deal cold damage through an ability or spell, you gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of your next turn.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you can borrow part of the Huntsman's incredible presence. While you’ve a creature under the effect of your Hex ability, having 0 hit points doesn’t knock you unconscious. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your Hex ends, and you die then only if you still have 0 hit points.

sheet.description: While you’ve a creature under the effect of your Hex ability, having 0 hit points doesn’t knock you unconscious. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your Hex ends, and you die then only if you still have 0 hit points.

description.p: You have made a pact with a legion, or more precisely, a legion has made a pact with you. In so doing these ten thousands souls grant you their power and experience of many lifetimes in exchange for being able to experience life once again through your eyes.

These souls were once people and many different legions have different stories. One might have once been the citizens of a city that was destroyed by war or disaster. Others may be a various collection of people who refused to move on to the afterlife. Yet still others might be an army who seek vengeance against a particular enemy.

sheet.description: Your patron is a collection of souls, willing to work with you to finish what they could not.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.
Starting at 1st level, the souls of the legion can become partly corporeal within 10 feet of you. This causes the area to gain the following effects:

ul.li: You and allied creatures within your aura have advantage on death saving throws.
The area within the aura counts as difficult terrain for creatures of your choice.
You can cast spells that require a melee spell attack, or have a range of touch against any creature within, or adjacent to, your aura.

sheet.description: You have an aura that extends to a 10-foot radius around you. You and allied creatures within your aura have advantage on death saving throws. The area within the aura counts as difficult terrain for creatures of your choice. You can cast spells that require a melee spell attack, or have a range of touch against any creature within, or adjacent to, your aura.

description.p: At 6th level, the souls of the dead can keep your enemies at bay. You can use an action to force any number of creatures you choose within your aura to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they take cold damage equal to 1d6 + half your warlock level and are pushed to the closest available space outside of your aura and they cannot enter your aura again until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to force any number of creatures you choose within your aura to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save they take cold damage equal to 1d6 + {{level:warlock:half}} and are pushed to the closest available space outside of your aura and they cannot enter your aura again until the start of your next turn.

description.p: At 10th level, your own growing power gives the legion greater corporeal strength. While within your aura, you and creatures of your choice have resistance to necrotic and cold damage, and gain the benefits of half cover against ranged attacks made from outside the aura.

sheet.description: While within your aura, you and creatures of your choice have resistance to necrotic and cold damage, and gain the benefits of half cover against ranged attacks made from outside the aura.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use an action to call forth your legion to stand at your side in battle. Your aura now extends out to 30 feet for 1 minute, and you can choose up to six creatures that are within your aura. Those creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level. If a creature is unconscious, it is restored to consciousness with 1 hit point. The temporary hit points lasts for 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can use an action to call forth your legion to stand at your side in battle. Your aura now extends out to 30 feet for 1 minute, and you can choose up to six creatures that are within your aura. Those creatures gain {{level:warlock}} temporary hit points. If a creature is unconscious, it is restored to consciousness with 1 hit point. The temporary hit points lasts for 1 minute.

description.p: The Seeker is an inscrutable being who travels the Astral Plane. Some of these beings are in search of knowledge and secrets while others are looking for a way to experience something else than the limitless Astral Sea.
In return for your patron’s gifts, you wander the world seeking the things it can't gather on its own, like lore or new experiences that you can share with your patron.

sheet.description: Your patron is a unique being that is stuck in the Astral Sea.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

Starting at 1st level, you can invoke the Seeker’s power to protect you from harm. As a bonus action, you create a whirling aurora of brilliant energy that swirls around you. Until the end of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage, and if a hostile creature ends its turn within 10 feet of you, it takes radiant damage equal to your warlock level + your Intelligence modifier.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you create a whirling aurora of brilliant energy that swirls around you. Until the end of your next turn, you gain resistance to all damage, and if a hostile creature ends its turn within 10 feet of you, it takes {{shielding aurora:dmg}} radiant damage.

description.p: At 6th level, you gain the ability to step into an astral refuge. As an action, you disappear from the world until the start of your next turn and enter the Astral Plane, taking advantage of its timeless nature. While in your astral refuge, you can take two actions to cast spells that target only you. After using those two actions, you return to the space you occupied and your turn ends.
