sheet.description: As an action, you disappear from the world until the start of your next turn and enter the Astral Plane, taking advantage of its timeless nature. While in your astral refuge, you can take two actions to cast spells that target only you. After using those two actions, you return to the space you occupied and your turn ends.

description.p: At 10th level, you no longer need to breathe, and you gain resistance to fire damage and cold damage.

sheet.description: You no longer need to breathe, and you gain resistance to fire damage and cold damage.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you gain the ability to sequester yourself and your allies on the Astral Plane.

By performing a special ritual over the course of 5 minutes, you shift yourself and up to ten willing creatures you can see to the Astral Plane. You and those creatures gain the benefits of a short rest while sequestered on the Astral Plane. You then return to the spaces you all occupied when you used this ability, with no time having passed in the world.
During this short rest, you and the creatures you sequester can make use of any options available during a rest that affect only you and the creatures you sequester.
Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

sheet.description: By performing a special ritual over the course of 5 minutes, you shift yourself and up to ten willing creatures you can see to the Astral Plane. You and those creatures gain the benefits of a short rest while sequestered on the Astral Plane. You then return to the spaces you all occupied when you used this ability, with no time having passed in the world. During this short rest, you and the creatures you sequester can make use of any options available during a rest that affect only you and the creatures you sequester.

description.p: You have made your pact with a sphinx, a creature as powerful as it is inscrutable. Unflinching guardians of divine treasures, from temples to enchanted artifacts, as well as living repositories of lore and ancient knowledge, sphinxes desire only to fulfill their divinely appointed missions.
Bound eternally to a single place of stewardship, some sphinxes choose to cede fractions of power to mortals, empowering them to act as their agents in the world abroad.

sheet.description: Your patron is a sphinx, a creature with power over time and space, made to keep secrets and hold the knowledge of the world.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.

At 1st level, your patron teaches you how to step through time just ahead of others around you. When you make an initiative check, you can add a bonus to the check equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Additionally, you gain proficiency in the History skill.

sheet.description: When you make an initiative check, you can add a bonus to the check of {{intelligence:modifier}}. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the History skill.

description.p: Beginning at 6th level, you have become able to alter others passage in time. After initiative is rolled, you can choose a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier to reroll their iniative check. They must use the new result.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: After initiative is rolled, you can choose {{intelligence:modifier}} creatures to reroll their iniative check. They must use the new result.

description.p: At 10th level, you have become able to shift others place in time. When a creature you can see makes an attack against a creature within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to alter time for the creature being attacked. The target of the attack gains a bonus to their AC equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of their next turn. After the attack they can move 5 feet in a direction of their choosing.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain your intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

sheet.description: When a creature you can see makes an attack against a creature within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to alter time for the creature being attacked. The target of the attack gains a bonus to their AC of {{intelligence:modifier}} until the end of their next turn. After the attack they can move 5 feet in a direction of their choosing. Additionally, Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain your intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

description.p: At 14th level, you can use your action to channel a fraction of your patron's thunderous roar. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can hear your roar must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 8d8 thunder damage and be stunned until the end of your next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not stunned. This roar is audible out to 500 feet.
Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can use your action to channel a fraction of your patron's thunderous roar. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you that can hear your roar must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 8d8 thunder damage and be stunned until the end of your next turn. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not stunned. This roar is audible out to 500 feet.

description.p: Death holds no sway over your patron, who has unlocked the secrets of everlasting life, although such a prize- like all power- comes at a price. Once mortal, the Undying has seen mortal lifetimes pass like the seasons, like the flicker of endless days and nights. It has the secrets of the ages to share, secrets of life and death.
Your patron could be vampire, lich, or another being who has unlocked the secrets of everlasting life.

sheet.description: Death holds no sway over your patron, who has unlocked the secrets of everlasting life, although such a prize- like all power- comes at a price.

description.p: You gain bestowed spells at the warlock levels listed.
At 1st level, your patron’s powers have a profound effect on your body and magic. You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe.
In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack and roll damage against the creature, you can deal an additional 1d6 necrotic damage.

sheet.description: You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack and roll damage against the creature, you can deal an additional 1d6 necrotic damage.

description.p: At 6th level, you can manifest an aspect of your patron’s dreadful power. As a bonus action, you transform for 1 minute. You gain the following benefits while transformed:

ul.li: You gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your warlock level.

Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, and if the saving throw fails, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
You are immune to the frightened condition.

description.p: You can transform a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you transform for 1 minute. You gain the following benefits while transformed: You gain 1d10 + {{level:warlock}} temporary hit points. Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, and if the saving throw fails, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn. You are immune to the frightened condition.

description.p: At 10th level, your connection to undeath and necrotic energy now saturates your body. You have resistance to necrotic and poison damage and have advantage on saving throws versus disease and the poisoned condition.
In addition, you age at a slower rate. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being magically aged.

sheet.description: You have resistance to necrotic and poison damage and have advantage on saving throws versus disease and the poisoned condition. In addition, you age at a slower rate. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being magically aged.

description.p: When you reach 14th level, you partake of some of the true secrets of the Undying. At the start of your turn, you regain hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Additionally, if you put a severed body part of yours back in place during your turn, the part reattaches.

sheet.description: At the start of your turn, you regain {{intelligence:modifier}} hit points. Additionally, if you put a severed body part of yours back in place during your turn, the part reattaches.

description.p: You can cast mage armor on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast mage armor on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You no longer need sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain benefits of a long rest, you must still perform only light activity, such as reading a book or keeping watch.

sheet.description: You no longer need sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain benefits of a long rest, you must still perform only light activity, such as reading a book or keeping watch.

description.p: Whenever you cast a spell using a warlock spell slot, you gain advantage on the first ability check you make before the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast a spell using a warlock spell slot, you gain advantage on the first ability check you make before the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can cast speak with animals at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast speak with animals at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

description.p: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a ranged attack cantrip, you can choose to either move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you or move it in a straight line 10 feet away from you.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a ranged attack cantrip, you can choose to either move that creature in a straight line 10 feet closer to you or move it in a straight line 10 feet away from you.

description.p: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

sheet.description: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

description.p: As an action, you can touch one unattended nonmagical object that weighs less than 10 pounds, such as a shield, gemstone, or glaive. The object disappears into a hidden pocket dimension. As an action on a subsequent turn, you can access this pocket dimension to retrieve the item. You can have only one item stored at a time, and an item that is under the effects of a magical spell or effect cannot be stored. If you die or are reduced to 0 hit points, the item exits the pocket dimension and falls to the ground in your space.

sheet.description: As an action, you can touch one unattended nonmagical object that weighs less than 10 pounds, such as a shield, gemstone, or glaive. The object disappears into a hidden pocket dimension. As an action on a subsequent turn, you can access this pocket dimension to retrieve the item. You can have only one item stored at a time, and an item that is under the effects of a magical spell or effect cannot be stored. If you die or are reduced to 0 hit points, the item exits the pocket dimension and falls to the ground in your space.

description.p: Any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

sheet.description: Any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

description.p: You can cast detect magic at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast detect magic at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can read all writing.

sheet.description: You can read all writing.

description.p: You can cast false life on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast false life on yourself at will as a 1st-level spell, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn.
While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

sheet.description: You can use your action to touch a willing humanoid and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can use your action on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you are blinded and deafened to your own surroundings.

description.p: Whenever you regain hit points, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

sheet.description: Whenever you regain hit points, treat any dice rolled to determine the hit points you regain as having rolled their maximum value for you.

description.p: You can cast arms of Hadar once without using a warlock spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
When you cast arms of Hadar, each creature that fails the saving throw cannot move until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You can cast arms of Hadar without using a warlock spell slot. When you cast arms of Hadar, each creature that fails the saving throw cannot move until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can cast cure wounds twice at its lowest level without expending a warlock spell slot, and regain the ability to do so after you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast cure wounds at its lowest level without expending a warlock spell slot.

description.p: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a cantrip, you can reduce that creature’s speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a cantrip, you can reduce that creature’s speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can cast Tasha's hideous laughter once without using a warlock spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast Tasha's hideous laughter without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast disguise self at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast disguise self at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast silent image at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast silent image at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a ranged attack cantrip, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet away from you.

sheet.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with a ranged attack cantrip, you can move that creature in a straight line 10 feet away from you.

description.p: You can cast bane once without using a warlock spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast bane without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast expeditious retreat at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast expeditious retreat at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can cast levitate on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast levitate on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can cast compulsion once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast compulsion without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast find steed once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast find steed without expending a spell slot.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura includes your space, extends 5 feet from you in every direction, and is blocked by total cover. It lasts until you're incapacitated or you dismiss it with a bonus action.

The aura grants you advantage on Intimidation (Charisma) checks but disadvantage on other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 0 damage).
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you can surround yourself with a magical aura that looks like buzzing flies. The aura includes your space, extends 5 feet from you in every direction, and is blocked by total cover. It lasts until you're incapacitated or you dismiss it with a bonus action. The aura grants you advantage on Intimidation (Charisma) checks but disadvantage on other Charisma checks. Any other creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {{intelligence:modifier}} poison damage.

description.p: You can cast ray of enfeeblement once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Additionally, while you concentrate on ray of enfeeblement, you have advantage on Strength-based attack rolls and Strength checks.

sheet.description: You can cast ray of enfeeblement without using a warlock spell slot. Additionally, while you concentrate on ray of enfeeblement, you have advantage on Strength-based attack rolls and Strength checks.

description.p: You can cast confusion once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast confusion without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain 10 temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. You also gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed drops to 0, and you are incapacitated. All of these effects end when the ice melts.
Once you use this invocation, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As a reaction when you take damage, you can entomb yourself in ice, which melts away at the end of your next turn. You gain {{frozen tomb:hp}} temporary hit points per warlock level, which take as much of the triggering damage as possible. You also gain vulnerability to fire damage, your speed drops to 0, and you are incapacitated. All of these effects end when the ice melts.

description.p: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have darkvision if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts until the end of the current turn. During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.
Once you use this invocations, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: As an action, you gain the ability to see through solid objects to a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you have darkvision if you don't already have it. This special sight lasts until the end of the current turn. During that time, you perceive objects as ghostly, transparent images.

description.p: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You can also cast water breathing without expending a spell slot. Once you cast it using this invocation, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can breathe underwater, and you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. You can also cast water breathing without expending a spell slot once per long rest.

description.p: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your Hex ability. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 damage).
To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your Hex ability. When you do so, you deal {{intelligence:modifier}} psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

description.p: You can cast animate dead without expending a spell slot. You can do so twice, and regain both uses when you complete a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast animate dead without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast slow once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast slow once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use an action to become invisible until you move or take an action or a reaction.

sheet.description: When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use an action to become invisible until you move or take an action or a reaction.

description.p: You can cast jump on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast jump on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your Hex ability. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

sheet.description: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of the target cursed by your Hex ability. To teleport in this way, you must be able to see the cursed target.

description.p: You can cast moonbeam once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast moonbeam once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast polymorph once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast polymorph once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast cloud of daggers once without using a warlock spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
As long as you concentrate on cloud of daggers, you can move the point the cube is centered on up to 30 feet as a bonus action on your turn.

sheet.description: You can cast cloud of daggers once without using a warlock spell slot. As long as you concentrate on cloud of daggers, you can move the point the cube is centered on up to 30 feet as a bonus action on your turn.

description.p: You can cast clairvoyance without expending a spell slot, and you don't require material components for the spell when you cast it this way. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast clairvoyance without expending a spell slot, and you don't require material components for the spell when you cast it this way.

description.p: You can cast bestow curse once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast bestow curse once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast freedom of movement once on yourself without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast freedom of movement once on yourself without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast augury once without expending a spell slot, and without material components. When cast this way, you can gain advantage on one attack roll or ability check of your choice that you make in the next hour, if it relates to the course of action you received an omen for.
Once you cast augury this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast augury once without expending a spell slot, and without material components. When cast this way, you can gain advantage on one attack roll or ability check of your choice that you make in the next hour, if it relates to the course of action you received an omen for.

description.p: Whenever you cast a spell with a range of Self using a warlock spell slot, choose one creature within 15 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. If they fail, they are charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: Whenever you cast a spell with a range of Self using a warlock spell slot, choose one creature within 15 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. If they fail, they are charmed by you until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can cast fly on yourself at will without expending a spell slot or material components.

sheet.description: You can cast fly on yourself at will without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can cast hold monster at will - targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental - without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

sheet.description: You can cast hold monster at will - targeting a celestial, fiend, or elemental - without expending a spell slot or material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this invocation on the same creature again.

description.p: You can cast contingency once without using a warlock spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast contingency once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast alter self at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast alter self at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast conjure elemental once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast conjure elemental once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast greater restoration without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast greater restoration without expending a spell slot or material components.

description.p: You can cast muder of crows once without using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast muder of crows once without using a warlock spell slot.

description.p: You can cast invisibility at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast invisibility at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast arcane eye at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast arcane eye at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast speak with dead at will, without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast speak with dead at will, without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within line of sight.

sheet.description: You can see the true form of any shapechanger or creature concealed by illusion or transmutation magic while the creature is within 30 feet of you and within line of sight.

description.p: You can cast teleportation circle once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast teleportation circle once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast plane shift once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast plane shift once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: Once during a long rest, you can cast dream without expending a spell slot. Casting this spell does not interfere with your rest.

sheet.description: Once during a long rest, you can cast dream without expending a spell slot. Casting this spell does not interfere with your rest.

description.p: You can use your Hex ability an unlimited number of times.

sheet.description: You can use your Hex ability an unlimited number of times.

description.p: You can ignore the verbal component of a warlock spell if it also has a somatic component. If the spell is on your bestowed spell list, it instead requires no components.

sheet.description: You can ignore the verbal component of a warlock spell if it also has a somatic component. If the spell is on your bestowed spell list, it instead requires no components.

description.p: You can cast Mordenkainen's magnificent mansion once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

sheet.description: You can cast Mordenkainen's magnificent mansion once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You can cast Otto's irresistible dance once without expending a spell slot. You cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: You can cast Otto's irresistible dance once without expending a spell slot.

description.p: You release a blast of sound with your voice (verbal component) or your instrument (somatic component). Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit the creature takes 1d10 thunder damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th (3d10), and 17th (4d10).

You touch one object that is 5 feet or smaller in any single dimension. Until the spell ends, the object absorbs natural light in a 20-foot radius sphere. Within that sphere, bright light becomes dim light and dim light becomes darkness. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

At 5th level, when you cast this spell and as a bonus action, you can increase or decrease the area up to a 30-foot radius and down to a minimum of 5-foot radius if you can see it and it is within 300 feet of you. At 11th level, you can fire a mote of shadow at an object up to 120 feet away, applying the spell's effects on contact. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell. At 17th level, when you cast this spell, you can make the darkness only affect some creatures, rendering the creatures unaffected by the reduced light.
You touch a willing creature and strengthens its resolve. If the target is frightened it can repeat its saving throw with advantage, ending the effect on a success.

At 5th level, the range of this spell increase to 15 feet. At 11th level, you can target up to three creatures. At 17th level, the targets are immune to the frightened condition for 1 minute on a success.

Sparks fly from your fingertips, shocking a creature within range. If the target is unconscious and reduced to 0 hit points, they gain advantage on their next death saving throw, and any ability check made to aid them also gains advantage. If you target a hostile creature, they must make a Constitution saving throw. If they fail, they take 1d8 lightning damage.
This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

You create a small concussive blast and force it towards a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice. A Large or larger creature makes this save with advantage. If the direction is blocked or the creature can't move due to being grappled, paralyzed, or restrained, the target doesn't move.
The distance pushed increases by 5 feet you reach 5th level (10), 11th level (15), and 17th level (20).
Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. That creature can immediately make a saving throw against an effect that allows it to make saving throws at the end on each of its turns.

At 5th level, the target can use your saving throws instead of its own. At 11th level, the spell gains a range of 30 feet and you can target any creature. At 17th level, you can target up to two creatures with this spell.

Your inflict a withering curse upon a 5-foot square of ground at a location you can see within range, withering plants and darkening the earth with fell power. At the start of each of your turns for the duration, the corruptive curse grows 5 feet in every direction. Whenever a creature starts its turn in a space afflicted by the curse, it must make a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it takes 1d6 necrotic damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

As you travel through the shadows, a spike of darkness shoots out from you. Choose a location within range that is within 5 feet of a creature or in dim light or darkness. You teleport to this location. As a bonus action before or after teleporting, you can make a single melee spell attack against a target within your reach. If you hit, the target takes 2d6 piercing damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the range increases by 5 feet and the psychic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You create a small but powerful explosion centered on a point within range. All creatures within 5 feet of that point take 1d4+1 force damage, and must make a Strength saving throw or be thrown 5 feet from the blast and knocked prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, increase the damage by 1d4 + 1 and push effect by 5 feet per spell level.

You let out a hunting cry, empowering your body with speed and tirelessness. You gain advantage on Athletics checks to jump, climb, swim, or move. You also gain advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and on checks to mitigate the effects of difficult terrain.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a slot of 2nd level or higher, your movement speed also increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

You channel the peculiarity of reptiles and gain the ability to shed your skin the same manner as a snake. Casting this spell while you are being grappled ends the condition and allows you to move up to 5 feet as part of casting the spell without provoking opportunity attacks.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can move an additional 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

You twist a creature's sense of balance and trick it into seeing the world shift beneath its feet. Choose a creature on a surface within range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, or fall prone and slide 20 feet in a straight line in a direction of your choice. If the target would fall off a ledge as a result of this movement, it can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw to prevent itself from falling and end the movement.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the distance slid increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 1st.

setters.set: a small metal ball and spring

description.p: You choose an area of dim light or darkness that you can see within range and that fits within a 20-foot cube. Each creature within the area must succeed on Strength saving throw or be restrained by shadows until the spell ends. A creature restrained by the shadows can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Until the spell ends, you can use an action on each of your turns to cause a tendril of shadow to reach out and grab a creature within 15 feet of the area. The creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pulled into the area and becomes restrained.
If the area becomes bathed in bright light, the spell has no effect until the bright light fades.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the cube increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

You quickly chill the air in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. Creatures in the affected area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d12 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the cold damage by 1d12 for each slot level above 2nd.

You conjure three barbed harpoons of intricately twisted silver, which float in the air above your head for the spell’s duration. When you cast the spell, and as an action while the spell lasts, you can make a ranged spell attack to hurl a harpoon at a target you can see within 90 feet of you. If you miss, the harpoon returns to the air above you.

If you hit, the target takes 1d6 piercing damage and the harpoon lodges in their flesh. For each harpoon lodged inside a creature, its speed is reduced by 5 feet and you can use a bonus action to pull the creature 10 feet towards you. The target can use an action to pull any number of harpoons out, taking 2d6 necrotic damage for each harpoon removed and causing the harpoon to fade. Once all three harpoons have faded, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

You select a creature within range and cold permeates its body. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes 1d6 cold damage at the start of each of its turns. At the end of each of its turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

Choose one creature that you can see within range. You transform that creature into a nonmagical object. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it succeeds, isn't affected by the spell. A target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

The target transforms along with whatever it is wearing and carrying into that form, as long as the object's size is no larger than the creature's size. The target gains 10 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points can't be replaced by temporary hit points from another source. A target reverts to its normal form when it has no more temporary hit points or the spell ends. If the spell ends before then, the creature loses all its temporary hit points and reverts to its normal form.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for every two slot levels above 2nd.

You create a small forcefield that attempts to pull all the creatures in the area towards the center. Any creature within 30 feet of a point you can see within range must make a Strength saving throw. Large or larger creatures have advantage on the saving throw. On a failure, the creature is pulled into a non-occupied space, as close to the center as possible and left prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the radius of the effect by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

A 15-foot wide, 60 foot long corridor of flowing space-time unfurls in a straight line in front of you, aiding or hindering travel along its length. You may choose whether the line flows towards or away from you. Creatures moving with the flow may move 2 feet for every one foot of spent movement, and those moving against it treat the area as difficult terrain.
For the duration, you can use your bonus action on your turn to reverse the polarity of the flow.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the length of the spell increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

You send out a blast of chaotic dark energy in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Any objects or constructs in the path of the spell takes the maximum amount of damage per die.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the force damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

You summon large wings behind you that beat with a furious cadence. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone and take 3d6 bludgeoning damage. On a success, a creature takes half damage but is not knocked prone. Until the end of your turn you gain a fly speed of 15 feet.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

You project a sphere of magic which turns the positive energy of healing magic into negative energy. Each time a creature within a 90-foot radius of you would recover hit points from a spell, it must make a Charisma saving throw. If it fails, it takes 1d8 necrotic damage and does not recover hit points.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

You infuse yourself with dark energies and corporeal shadow, twisting your form into a terrible caricature. Until the spell ends, you become heavily obscured and gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. While you are under the effects of this spell, you can move through spaces as small as one square inch without squeezing.

While in this form, you cannot take actions other than the Attack action. The first time you make an attack, you make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet as you unleash a deadly spike of shadow. On a hit, your target takes 6d6 necrotic damage. Once you've done this, or you take radiant damage, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You cast your senses out into the universe, seeking to detect the magical emanations of other spellcasters, energies from beyond the Material Plane, or other eldritch powers. Whenever a creature within 300 feet casts a spell, you are aware of the level of the spell and the school of magic. You are aware of the starting and ending location of any teleportation within 300 feet of you. Whenever a creature that is not native to your current plane enters the range of this spell, you become aware of their plane of origin, general direction, and approximate distance.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius increases by 300 feet for each slot level above 3rd.
When you cast this spell, you shield yourself from unnatural energies. You gain advantage on saving throws against the frightened and charmed conditions.
Additionally, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and whenever you take damage, you can use your reaction to inflict 2d12 psychic damage to your attacker.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 3rd.

You reach out and snatch a creature you can see within range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is grappled by you (escape DC equal to your spell save DC). While you are grappling the target, you have resistance to all damage, and each time you take damage the target takes the same amount of damage.
The spell ends if the grapple ends or if the target dies.

setters.set: a rusted iron ring worth at least 10 gp

description.p: You summon a burning incorporeal spear and launch it towards a target with range. Make a ranged spell attack against that target. If there are any creatures 10 feet or less directly behind the target you in a line and the attack roll would also hit them, they are also hit. On a hit, a creature takes 5d10 fire damage.
Additionally, their speed drops to 0 until the start of your next turn, when the spear dissipates.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

You summon a spirit in the form of a bird of prey and command it to charge ahead. It covers a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 6d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You see everything on its path, remembering it as if you had seen it personally.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You swap the positions of two creatures of the same size (Medium and Small counts as the same) that you can see within range. If a creature is unwilling, it can make a Charisma saving throw to resist being teleported. If either creature succeeds, the spell is lost.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. As long as two creatures fail their save, the spell succeeds.

element.name: Awareness
element.supports: Artificer, Druid, Ranger, Warlock, Wizard, Occultist

description.p: You create an invisible magical sensor that floats just above your head and shares your space. You can see through the sensor in all directions. For the duration, no melee attack roll can have advantage against you, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight.

You channel divine energies into your body, enlarging you and enhancing your most poignant attributes. Your size increases to Large if it is smaller, and your equipment grows to suit your expanded form. While in this form, your attacks inflict an additional 1d8 radiant or necrotic damage (your choice) and you gain 10 temporary hit points equal at the start of each of your turns that last for the duration of the spell.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 4th.

You feed on a creature's deepest-set fears and terrors, wracking it with terrible pain. Choose one creature you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is made with disadvantage if it is frightened. On a failure, it suffers damage depending on its frightened status.
Not frightened. 8d6 psychic damage.
Frightened, but not of you. 10d6 psychic damage.
Frightened of you. 11d6 psychic damage.
On a success, it takes half as much damage.
At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each spell slot above 4th.

You peer into the machinations of an enemy's mind, and use this information against them. A creature in range that you can see must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, you have advantage on all skill checks and attacks against them and they have disadvantage on all skill checks and attacks against you as long as they are within 10 feet of you.

You automatically know the target’s location if it is on the same plane of existence. The target can never be hidden from you. You can see through any illusions conjured by the target, or of the target. Any time that creature would need to guess your location (for example, if there are multiple images of you or because you are hidden), it guesses wrong.

A creature that sees you, that you can see within range becomes the singular focus of your hunt. While the spell is active, you always know where the creature is, and it cannot be hidden from you. In addition, you can sense what areas are in the target’s line of sight. On a subsequent turn, you can use your bonus action to teleport to a location within 30 feet of the target as long as the location isn’t in the target’s line of sight. If the location is occupied or is in a solid material, such as a wall, the teleportation fails. It also fails if you and the creature aren’t on the same plane.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 4th.

With a gesture, you summon the spirits of two dire wolves into your space. When you cast this spell, and as an action on each of your turns while it is in effect, you can command the wolves to attack a creature within 40 feet. You can command them to attack one or two targets.

Make a melee spell attack for each wolf, if they attack the same target, you can roll with advantage. On a hit, the target takes 2d4 + 2 piercing damage and must make a Strength saving throw. Even if a targeted by several wolves, it only has to make one saving throw. On a failure, it is knocked prone. After making their attack, the wolfs reappear at your side.
While the spell is active, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track a creature.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you summon an additional wolf for each slot level above 4th.

You and your allies have a perfect moment of luck. Until the start of your next turn, you and up to 7 other creatures you choose within range have advantage on one attack or saving throw of their choice.

setters.set: a four-leaf clover made of gold, worth at least 75 gold

description.p: You step into a shrouded space outside reality for a brief moment, gathering your power and waiting for a chance to strike. Until the start of your next turn, you are transported to a harmless demiplane and the space you were in is heavily obscured by magical darkness.
Your first successful attack during your next turn inflicts an additional 4d6 psychic damage and knocks your target prone.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th.

You brace yourself and briefly thrust yourself through the ethereal plane, teleporting to a location within range. If you exit within 5 feet of a creature you can force it to make a Charisma saving throw as you try to thrust them away from the Material plane. On a failed save one, choose one of the following effects:
Temporal Jump. The target is banished to a harmless demiplane until the end of its next turn. While there, the target is Incapacitated. No time passes for the target while it is banished.

Temporal Acceleration. The target is banished to a harmless demiplane until the start of its next turn. Any spells affecting the target with a duration less than one hour end, as well as any such spells the target is concentrating on.

After the effect, the target appears 15 feet away from the location you teleported to, in a straight line. If there isn't a clear path to the destination, the creature appears in front of the obstruction.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range and distance the target is teleported increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

With a word, you invoke the searing radiance of the higher planes to strike down your attacker. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If they fail, they are blinded until the start of your next turn and take 5d10 radiant damage. If they succeed, they take half as much damage and are not blinded.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take in response to being damage by a creature within 60 feet of you that you can see

description.p: Choose a creature that you can see within range. If the target can see you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 8d6 cold damage and is paralyzed until the end of your next turn unless it is immune to cold damage. The paralysis ends early if the creature takes damage or if the spell ends. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't paralyzed. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of you for the duration.
At the end of each of its turns, the frightened target can make another Wisdom saving throw, which is made with disadvantage if it can see you. On a success, the effect ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

Flames wreathe one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 7d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell’s duration. The burning target sheds bright light in a 30- foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the end of each of its turns, the target takes 4d6 fire damage and repeats the saving throw, ending the spell on a success. These magical flames can’t be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target is turned to ash.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

A wave of vertigo erupts from your hands as the world bends, spins, and collapses in the minds of your enemies. Choose any number of creatures within range. Target creatures must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw, or fall prone and slide 20 feet in a straight line in a direction of your choice. If the target would fall off a ledge as a result of this movement, it can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw to prevent itself from falling and end the movement.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the distance sled increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a storm of crows, centered on a point you can see within range and spreading to a radius of 30 feet. Each creature within the area when it appears must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d4 slashing damage and becomes blinded for 1 minute. On a success it is not blinded and takes half damage. A blinded creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
At the start of each turn any creature within the area takes 6d4 slashing damage.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both damage instances increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 5th.
You call forth large dark and twisted wings from your back, followed by darkness, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet and lightly obscuring you.

As an action while you have these wings, you can choose to unleash the nightmares trapped within them, ending the spell and releasing a wave of darkness. Magical darkness spread from a point centered on you, filling a 30-foot radius for the remainder of the spell's duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can’t see through this darkness. Non-magical light can't illuminate the area.
Whenever a creature starts its turn in the sphere, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it drops prone and becomes frightened until the end of your next turn.

You drain the life energies of creatures around you, damaging them and healing yourself. Up to 5 creatures of your choice within 15 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3d6 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one. You regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, increase the damage by 1d6 per spell level.

You gain the ability to blink from one shadow to another. When you are in dim light or darkness, you can use 5 feet of movement to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. You can use this teleportation ability twice per round for the duration.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the distance teleported increases by up to 10 feet for each slot level above 5th.

element.name: Voidsight
element.supports: Artificer, Bard, Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Occultist

description.p: This spell gives the willing creature you touch the ability to perceive its surroundings without relying on sight. It gains blindsight 60 feet for the duration.
